dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5741 IH: Uniform Treatment of Custodial Assets Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Flood (for himself, Mr. Torres of New York, Mr. Hill, and Mr. Nickel) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To prohibit certain Federal agencies from requiring certain institutions to include assets held in custody as a liability, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Uniform Treatment of Custodial Assets Act.

subsection.text: The appropriate Federal banking agency, the National Credit Union Administration (in the case of a credit union), and the Securities and Exchange Commission may not require or take supervisory action that would cause a depository institution, national bank, Federal credit union, State credit union, trust company, or any affiliate thereof—

paragraph.text: except as provided in subsection (b), to include assets held in custody or safekeeping, or the assets associated with a cryptographic key held in custody or safekeeping, as a liability on such institution’s financial statement or balance sheet;

to hold additional regulatory capital against assets in custody, or safekeeping, or the assets associated with a cryptographic key held in custody or safekeeping, except as necessary to mitigate against operational risks under regulations with general application, as determined by—

subparagraph.text: the appropriate Federal banking agency or State bank supervisor;
the National Credit Union Administration (in the case of a credit union); or
a State credit union supervisor; or

paragraph.text: to recognize a liability for any obligations related to activities or services performed for digital assets that such institution does not have beneficial ownership of if that liability would exceed the expense recognized in the income statement as a result of the corresponding obligation.

subsection.text: Cash held for a third party by an institution described in subsection (a) may be treated as a liability on such institution’s financial statement or balance sheet if such cash is commingled with the general assets of such institution.

paragraph.text: The term affiliate has the meaning given the term in section 2 of the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 (12 U.S.C. 1841).
The terms Federal credit union and State credit union have the meaning given those terms, respectively, in section 101 of the Federal Credit Union Act (12 U.S.C. 1752).

The terms appropriate Federal banking agency, depository institution, and State bank supervisor have the meanings given the terms, respectively, in section 3 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1813).
The term State credit union supervisor means a State official described in section 107A(e) of the Federal Credit Union Act (12 U.S.C. 1757a(e)).
